Replace.Text: A mechanized weapons company, sometimes called a manoeuvre support company, is a company-sized military unit attached to an infantry battalion to support the rifle companies of the battalion. It usually possesses some combination of machine guns, automatic grenade launchers, mortars, anti-armor missiles, anti-aircraft missiles, reconnaissance troops (which usually includes snipers) and assault pioneers (infantrymen specially trained in the assault role). Traditionally these infantrymen are foot soldiers but from WW2 onwards they are mounted in either APCs or AFVs in mechanized infantry battalions.
